Quick Demo

Lisa DeBruine & Daniel Lakens

2019-07-09

Source: vignettes/demo.Rmd
demo.Rmd

Here is a quick example of setting up a simple study.

Set up an empty study object

library(scienceverse)
#> 
#> ************
#> Welcome to scienceverse For support and examples visit:
#> http://scienceverse.github.io/
#> - Get and set global package options with: scienceverse_options()
#> ************

mystudy <- study("IAT Demo")

Add hypothesis 1

mystudy <- add_hypothesis(
  study = mystudy,
  description = "Mean RT will be significantly slower in the incongruent condition compared to the congruent condition.",
  evaluation = "&", # all criteria must be true to accept
  id = "H1"
)

Add analysis 1

Reference data you will attach later as “.data[id]” (here, we will use the id “iat”).

mystudy <- add_analysis(
  study = mystudy,
  func = "t.test",
  params = list(
    x = ".data[iat]$incongruent",
    y = ".data[iat]$congruent",
    alternative = "two.sided",
    paired = TRUE,
    var.equal = FALSE,
    conf.level = 0.95
  ),
  id = "H1_ttest"
)

Add criteria to H1

Criteria results reference named list items returned from the analysis (e.g., the t.test in H1_ttest returns a list including p.value and estimate).

# add criterion 1 to hypothesis 1
mystudy <- add_criterion(
  study = mystudy,
  result = "p.value",
  operator = "<",
  comparator = .05,
  hypothesis_id = "H1",
  analysis_id = "H1_ttest"
)

# add criterion 2 to hypothesis 1
mystudy <- add_criterion(
  study = mystudy,
  result = "estimate",
  operator = ">",
  comparator = 0,
  hypothesis_id = "H1",
  analysis_id = "H1_ttest"
)

Add hypothesis 2

mystudy <- add_hypothesis(
  study = mystudy,
  description = "Reaction times for congruent and incongruent trials will be signifiantly and positively correlated.",
  evaluation = "&",
  id = "H2"
)

Add analysis 2

mystudy <- add_analysis(
  study = mystudy,
  func = "cor.test",
  params = list(
    x = ".data[iat]$congruent",
    y = ".data[iat]$incongruent",
    alternative = "two.sided",
    method = "pearson",
    conf.level = 0.95
  ),
  id = "H2_cor"
)

Add criteria to H2

# add criterion 2 to hypothesis 2
mystudy <- add_criterion(
  study = mystudy,
  result = "p.value",
  operator = "<",
  comparator = 0.05,
  hypothesis_id = "H2",
  analysis_id = "H2_cor"
)

# add criterion 2 to hypothesis 2
mystudy <- add_criterion(
  study = mystudy,
  result = "estimate",
  operator = ">",
  comparator = 0,
  hypothesis_id = "H2",
  analysis_id = "H2_cor"
)

Save the pre-registration archive file

study_save(mystudy, "iat.json")

Generate the pre-registration report


study_report(mystudy, template="prereg", filename = "prereg")

Hypotheses

Hypothesis 1

Mean RT will be significantly slower in the incongruent condition compared to the congruent condition.

  • Criterion 1 is confirmed if analysis yields p.value < 0.05
  • Criterion 2 is confirmed if analysis yields estimate > 0

If all criteria are met, this hypothesis is supported.

Hypothesis 2

Reaction times for congruent and incongruent trials will be signifiantly and positively correlated.

  • Criterion 1 is confirmed if analysis yields p.value < 0.05
  • Criterion 2 is confirmed if analysis yields estimate > 0

If all criteria are met, this hypothesis is supported.

Analyses

Analysis 1 : H1_ttest

We will run t.test(x = .data[iat]$incongruent, y = .data[iat]$congruent, alternative = two.sided, paired = TRUE, var.equal = FALSE, conf.level = 0.95)

 t.test

Analysis 2 : H2_cor

We will run cor.test(x = .data[iat]$congruent, y = .data[iat]$incongruent, alternative = two.sided, method = pearson, conf.level = 0.95)

 cor.test

Load the study info from the archive file

mystudy <- study("iat.json")

Add data

Simulate some data using faux::sim_design() (learn more about faux).

# simulate some data
dat <- faux::sim_design(
  within = list(condition = c("congruent", "incongruent")),
  n = 50, 
  mu = c(500, 750), 
  sd = 250, 
  r = .5
)

Add the data to the study object. Make sure the id matches the data id from the analysis parameters.

mystudy <- add_data(mystudy, dat, id = "iat")

Run analyses

mystudy <- study_analyse(mystudy)
#> Hypothesis 1, Criterion 1: p.value = 2.07387231667966e-10 (p.value < 0.05 is TRUE)
#> Hypothesis 1, Criterion 2: estimate = 262.610534912282 (estimate > 0 is TRUE)
#> Hypothesis 2, Criterion 1: p.value = 0.0038429580070633 (p.value < 0.05 is TRUE)
#> Hypothesis 2, Criterion 2: estimate = 0.401609882698672 (estimate > 0 is TRUE)

Generate the post-registration report


study_report(mystudy, template="postreg", filename = "postreg")

Results

Hypothesis 1

Mean RT will be significantly slower in the incongruent condition compared to the congruent condition.

  • Criterion 1 was p.value < 0.05 in analysis H1_ttest.
    The result was p.value = 0
  • Criterion 2 was estimate > 0 in analysis H1_ttest.
    The result was estimate = 262.611

Conclusion: All criteria were met, this hypothesis was supported.

Hypothesis 2

Mean RT will be significantly slower in the incongruent condition compared to the congruent condition.

  • Criterion 1 was p.value < 0.05 in analysis H2_cor.
    The result was p.value = 0.004
  • Criterion 2 was estimate > 0 in analysis H2_cor.
    The result was estimate = 0.402

Conclusion: All criteria were met, this hypothesis was supported.

Piped setup


mystudy <- study("IAT Demo")  %>%
  add_hypothesis(
    description = "Mean RT will be significantly slower in the incongruent condition compared to the congruent condition.",
    evaluation = "&", id = "H1") %>%
  add_analysis(
    func = "t.test",
    params = list(
      x = ".data[1]$incongruent",
      y = ".data[1]$congruent",
      alternative = "two.sided",
      paired = TRUE,
      var.equal = FALSE,
      conf.level = 0.95
    ),
    id = "H1_ttest"
  ) %>%
  add_criterion(
    result = "p.value",
    operator = "<",
    comparator = .05,
    hypothesis_id = "H1",
    analysis_id = "H1_ttest"
  ) %>%
  add_criterion(
    result = "estimate",
    operator = ">",
    comparator = 0,
    hypothesis_id = "H1",
    analysis_id = "H1_ttest"
  ) %>%
  add_hypothesis(
    description = "Reaction times for congruent and incongruent trials will be signifiantly and positively correlated.",
    evaluation = "&", id = "H2"
  ) %>%
  add_analysis(
    func = "cor.test",
    params = list(
      x = ".data[1]$congruent",
      y = ".data[1]$incongruent",
      alternative = "two.sided",
      method = "pearson",
      conf.level = 0.95
    ),
    id = "H2_cor"
  ) %>%
  add_criterion(
    result = "p.value",
    operator = "<",
    comparator = 0.05,
    hypothesis_id = "H2",
    analysis_id = "H2_cor"
  ) %>%
  add_criterion(
    result = "estimate",
    operator = ">",
    comparator = 0,
    hypothesis_id = "H2",
    analysis_id = "H2_cor"
  ) %>%
  add_data(dat) %>%
  study_analyse()
#> Hypothesis 1, Criterion 1: p.value = 2.07387231667966e-10 (p.value < 0.05 is TRUE)
#> Hypothesis 1, Criterion 2: estimate = 262.610534912282 (estimate > 0 is TRUE)
#> Hypothesis 2, Criterion 1: p.value = 0.0038429580070633 (p.value < 0.05 is TRUE)
#> Hypothesis 2, Criterion 2: estimate = 0.401609882698672 (estimate > 0 is TRUE)
mystudy %>%
  study_report(template="prereg", filename = "pre") %>%
  study_report(template="postreg", filename = "post")
